docs.snippet: LEAD: FOR most people, walking is a simple matter of putting one foot in front of the other. In the cosmic scheme of things, it is up there with sleeping and sitting, something we take for granted, as life shambles along. But there is a new moveme...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: FOR most people, walking is a simple matter of putting one foot in front of the other. In the cosmic scheme of things, it is up there with sleeping and sitting, something we take for granted, as life shambles along. But there is a new movement afoot.

headline.main: Fast-Track Tool: A Walk With Style

docs.snippet: LEAD: AS goes Costa Rica's economy, so goes Latin America's? Fears of setting a precedent for the Latin mega-debtors - Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Venezuela - have stopped foreign banks from settling accounts on realistic terms with this tiny natio...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AS goes Costa Rica's economy, so goes Latin America's? Fears of setting a precedent for the Latin mega-debtors - Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Venezuela - have stopped foreign banks from settling accounts on realistic terms with this tiny nation. But now Costa Rica's sophisticated financial negotiators have turned the tables on their commercial creditors.

headline.main: Economic Scene; Costa Rica's Debt Message

docs.snippet: LEAD: An exhibition of puppets and masks from the Brander Matthews Dramatic Museum is to be on display in the Low Library Rotunda at Columbia University, 116th Street and Broadway, from Wednesday through Feb. 21. The show, sponsored by the Oscar H...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: An exhibition of puppets and masks from the Brander Matthews Dramatic Museum is to be on display in the Low Library Rotunda at Columbia University, 116th Street and Broadway, from Wednesday through Feb. 21. The show, sponsored by the Oscar Hammerstein 2d Center for Theater Studies, includes Noh masks, dance masks from Java and Thailand, carnival masks from Latin America, French marionettes and shadow figures from several countries.

headline.main: Exhibition of Puppets Is Coming to Columbia

headline.main: Jean Alice Brashear Is Wed in Pittsburgh

docs.snippet: LEAD: ''MYSTERY - THAT'S THE key word about Bobby. One thing he never talks about is his craft. He never does - that one area is a closed door.'' That is the director Simon Wincer, speaking by phone from his cattle ranch in Mooroolbark, Australia,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''MYSTERY - THAT'S THE key word about Bobby. One thing he never talks about is his craft. He never does - that one area is a closed door.'' That is the director Simon Wincer, speaking by phone from his cattle ranch in Mooroolbark, Australia, half a world away, about the American actor Robert Duvall.

headline.main: Robert Duvall: The Actor As Chameleon

byline.original: By NAN ROBERTSON; Nan Robertson, a former New York Times reporter, frequently writes on the performing arts

docs.snippet: LEAD: ONCE AGAIN, AS IN NINE previous years, the Grands Prix for audio have been announced. Under the aegis of Audio-Video International, a leading trade journal, a jury of technical experts chose outstanding audio components of 1988 from a list o...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ONCE AGAIN, AS IN NINE previous years, the Grands Prix for audio have been announced. Under the aegis of Audio-Video International, a leading trade journal, a jury of technical experts chose outstanding audio components of 1988 from a list of nominations submitted through a nationwide poll of audio dealers.

docs.snippet: LEAD: It WAS 90 MINUTES TO CURTAIN TIME the other evening in the stately 104-year-old Comedy Theater on Panton Street, where Lee Blessing's two-character drama, ''A Walk in the Woods,'' has been playing since the first week in November. Here, the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: It WAS 90 MINUTES TO CURTAIN TIME the other evening in the stately 104-year-old Comedy Theater on Panton Street, where Lee Blessing's two-character drama, ''A Walk in the Woods,'' has been playing since the first week in November. Here, the cast is Anglo-American. Early last year the play had modest success with an all-American cast on Broadway at the Booth Theater.

headline.main: Back on Stage, Challenges for Mr. Guinness
